postings.description:
As Netflix continues to develop unique original content and build the world's most technology-driven studio, the drive to innovate around solutions, logistics, scheduling, and software grows. Simply put, our goal is to provide our production and media partners with tools superior to anything else out there, and support the effort to create the most productive and creative studio the world has ever seen.
 
As a Netflix Production Support Specialist, you will play a critical role by providing remote technical support to a user base of internal Netflix employees, production, and media partners utilizing our Netflix Studio technology and applications. You'll do this as a part of a global support team for our Studio technology. The NPS team ensures an exceptional experience for our users by providing remote support to critical production and media software while providing insight back to studio product teams to solve challenges with our technology as an advocate for the users that they support. Your top priorities will be managing technical issues, research, documentation, business to business relationships, analyze trends and the impact of these issues with the ultimate goal of driving improvements in the Netflix Studio applications and overall user  experience. 

What you will be doing:

  • You will be a part of the global Netflix Production Support team that provides user facing Tier 1 remote technical troubleshooting for our Studio Technology. 
  • You will contribute to our overall working environment and culture, where expressing your thoughts and sharing your feedback is a part of your every day.
  • You will contribute to a growing, diverse and inclusive culture by encouraging an open minded and supportive environment 
  • You will receive incoming support request emails/tickets, chats, and phone contacts from our Studio technology users.
  • You will be focused on ensuring a high level of support is maintained for our users and continuously look for improvements to the support experience.
  • You will participate in and own daily support work and projects, including knowledge base content updates, bug triage and prioritization, user facing outage management, and escalation of issues to our 2nd tier of support.
  • You will collaborate with your colleagues in a global setting, partnering with our other offices to share ideas and feedback to ensure our operational alignment, support, documentation, and research is of the highest calibre 
  • You will work with key stakeholders from various departments maintaining alignment and effectively partnering towards common goals and initiatives
  • You will compose feature request/bug reporting documentation as well as creating reports on current issues impacting our users and products
  • You will seek to expose user friction and reliability concerns within the products and processes that also drive pain for our production teams

Who you are:

  • You have a strong background and at least 3+ years of experience in a technical troubleshooting, research, documentation and/or support engineer role; documenting the users experience and determining the root cause of technical issues. Experience and knowledge of film production and or post production is a plus.
  • You have experience supporting micro services, Enterprise Level Google Suite and Admin, Cloud, SaaS, and/or SSO based software.
  • You have a comprehension of codecs and data transfer protocols with knowledge of digital file specs and size formats.
  • You have experience working with software support tools such as Zendesk, JIRA, and Confluence or similar products.
  • You have the ability to analyze and document trends in our support and data to assess the priority and impact of issues. 
  • You are always on the lookout for opportunities to improve our operations, user experiences, and deliver cohesive ideas around innovative support strategies and application design considerations.
  • You have strong communication skills to partner with technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively in a remote environment and are are proficient with phone, email, and computer-based support solutions
  • You love to create and define new support solutions, offer highly effective solutions to their problems, cut out complexity, and get teams back to being productive.
  • You thrive in an innovative culture where autonomy is necessary, and strong collaboration is paramount.
  • You have fluency in English and other languages such as Japanese, Korean are a strong plus.
  • You have the flexibility to work evening and weekend shifts, at times.

postings.text: Manager, Production Finance - International Original Film
postings.description:
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 150 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. 
The Manager of Production Finance for UK & EMEA Films is a core role responsible for working cross functionally with Creative, Business and Legal Affairs, Physical Production, Post and VFX to financially manage local language productions produced throughout the world. This role would be responsible for providing production finance support to facilitate producing great content. This may include tactical and strategic solutions ii) providing accurate, timely and complete production budgets and estimated final costs iii) protecting company assets through cash management, policies and procedures. 

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with Line Producers, Production Managers, Accounting Staff and the Netflix Originals team to deliver the highest quality original entertainment content. 
  • Research, develop and test new technologies that provide the next generation of production finance tools and determine how and when to best incorporate into the production accounting workflow. 
  • Hire the most talented production accounting teams with the skillset to provide the highest level of production accounting support on shows that are some of the most ambitious and complex to be ever produced. Accounting teams must be self –motivated, resourceful, dedicated, hard working, focused and strive for only the highest level of professional ethics, consistent mathematical accuracy and completeness, and embody the Netflix ethos. 
  • Liaise with Netflix HR, Labor Relations, Content Accounting, Internal Audit, Payroll, Accounts Payable, Treasury, IT to ensure production finance policies and procedures are current and effectively implemented on our productions. 
  • Prepare or review initial production budgets. 
  • Manage production incentive workflow and ensure receipt of tax credits or cash.
  • Ensure that insurance claim costs are accurate and adequately supported by schedules, invoices and payroll documents. 
  • Manage the cash flow and funding processes. 
  • Review production budgets, cost reports, trial balances and petty cash reconciliations prepared by show accountants.
  • Work with show accountants on a day to day basis to drive accurate, complete and timely cost reporting, protecting and managing show assets and supporting production. 
  • Identify problem area as quickly as possible including breakdown in 
  • communication between department heads, upm’s, producers and accountants and minimal use of PO’s. 
  • Develop relationships with Film Commissioners, CPA audit firms, Accountants, Producers and Payroll Companies to build resources and networks from which to poll industry information and help ensure all production finance processes are current, reasonable and timely. 
  • Facilitate the training and mentoring of junior production accounting staff on Netflix shows with the goal of increasing the pool of loyal “star” accounting candidates for future Netflix productions. 
  • Keep abreast of current and changing industry trends, evolving technologies, production incentives and changes in crew capacity and infrastructure support in the main worldwide production centers. 
  • Travel to production locations where our shows are filming to audit, review work flows, organizational abilities and effectiveness of accounting staff. 

Requirements:

  • Candidates must have 15+ years in scripted television production accounting.
  • Candidates must have 10+ years working as a Lead Production Accountant on local and distant location major studio size productions. 
  • Broad understanding of production incentives. 
  • Solid understanding of payroll process, union labor agreements and tax requirements. 
  • Complete understanding of P2P process and tax requirements. 
  • Expert skill level of Movie Magic Budgeting and either Vista or PSL production accounting systems. 
  • College degree in accounting or finance from a well-known university is preferred.
  • Proven ability to lead and manage a team. 
  • Solution focused. - particular interest in training
  • Ability to understand and articulate issues using creative, production or financial context.

postings.description:
With so many different titles to choose across a range of tastes and cultural standards, how can we let members know that what they’re watching is appropriate for their household?

The Ratings Architecture team develops and supports a global, scalable system that accurately classifies and rates entertainment content. Across back-end metadata, external research, and front-end display, this role is responsible for transparently conveying the maturity level, appropriateness, and content flags of every title in our catalog, tailored to every country in the world. It requires knowledge of content policies and cultural sensitivities as well as the operational and analytical aptitude to implement those policies in a scalable way.

The right candidate is adept at analyzing data from various sources (both qualitative and quantitative) to identify trends that can be applied to internal systems in order to generate accurate local maturity ratings. You learn internal tools and systems quickly, are curious and thoughtful about different cultures’ sensibilities, and have a proven ability to work at scale. You are comfortable communicating with various teams, such as Engineering, Public Policy, and Communications. You make thoughtful decisions that balance our ability to move quickly while still providing the right context to our members.

Reporting to the Ratings Architecture Manager, this role is located in our Los Gatos or Los Angeles office.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in relevant fields, such as Content Classification, Content Strategy, Standards & Practices, Policy/Legal Operations, Data Analysis, Natural Language Processing/Understanding, or Taxonomy/Information Architecture management.
  • Consistent record of developing and implementing processes and solutions for a high volume of content at a global scale.
  • An aptitude for analyzing trends in data to solve problems.
  • Ability to strategically assess risk, and develop solutions that mitigate exposure, while supporting the business at scale.
  • Experience working in adapting contexts - across different cultures, changing social norms, and current events.
  • Experience working with databases, information management systems, keywords/metadata, and/or rule-based categorization models.
  • Excellent project management skills, with a focus on operational excellence.
  • Ability to communicate and influence across various function groups.

Responsibilities

  • Manage projects related to locally relevant and scalable output of maturity ratings and content advisories, including but not limited to title classification, rule management, board submissions, and quality assessment.
  • Identify where ratings requirements of regulatory bodies and consumer expectations around content sensitivities can be addressed via workflows, processes, or tooling.
  • Draft documentation that describes problem, scope, and product requirements needed to execute strategic ratings initiatives.
  • Participate in working groups that will collaborate and execute against said requirements, representing and making decisions on behalf of the Ratings Team.
  • Liaise between multiple function areas, conveying expectations around requirements, priorities, costs/benefits, risks, and efficiencies.
  • Advise on what is functionally feasible versus what cannot be meaningfully implemented.
  • Manage launches including crafting and working on interim solutions and workarounds.
  • Develop subject matter expertise and train partners and teammates on ratings tools and workflows.
  • Development and implementation of ratings features in the product.
  • Upholding and maintaining ratings compliance across A-B tests.
  • Full support of ongoing, official local submission processes and workflow.

Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment by producing, distributing, and streaming content at a massive scale. Over 200 million members around the globe are currently enjoying more than two billion hours per month of original series, documentaries and feature films.  Visit our long-term view to learn more.
 
The Team
The Privacy Assurance & Engineering team promotes privacy-enhancing designs, sets engineering standards and builds systems to ensure Netflix is managing data correctly. We are a small and agile team with tremendous visibility and impact, and with Netflix’s culture of  “Freedom and Responsibility” you’ll decide how to best use your talents and time.

The Role
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to build privacy engineering solutions spanning over the entire Netflix infrastructure. In this role, you will partner closely with other engineers,  data scientists and TPMs to design, prototype, develop, run and improve data cataloging, detection and metadata systems at scale. This role provides an unique opportunity to work across diverse environments including distributed systems, data streaming and data warehouse solutions. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and impact the business in a meaningful way.

Desired Background:

  • You are passionate about data privacy.
  • You are a strong software engineer with current expertise in at least one major language (e.g. Java, Python).
  • You excel in using SQL (any variant) with large data sets, and have built data pipelines on technologies such as Spark, Presto, Flink or Kafka.
  • You have a bias towards action and are comfortable navigating through ambiguous environments.
  • You’re able to communicate complex technical topics to diverse audiences with varying technical and subject matter backgrounds.
Stunning colleagues come from different education levels and backgrounds. The Netflix culture determines who we hire, how we work together and how we make decisions. You will be surrounded by a great team and empowered to produce your best work.

postings.description:
We are seeking a Stage Coordinator to join our growing Production Facilities Management and Operations team. This position will be housed in Brooklyn, New York. The position will be responsible for serving as a liaison between Studio Operations and Production on a daily basis. The goal of this role is to elevate the client experience and provide the highest level of customer service possible. 

The Opportunity
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with 200 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

The Role
A successful candidate will be passionate, self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and communication. 

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Knowledge and experience in production terminology supporting various departments (i.e., Construction, Location, Rigging Grip, Rigging Electric, Set Dec., Costumes, Hair & Make-Up, SPFX, Casting, Production Office, Stunts, etc.) 
  • Establishing and maintaining a good working relationship with all Productions, Vendors, and Tenants.
  • Strong understanding of EHS local regulations and best practices.
  • Manage communications regarding any scheduled shoot that might affect building occupants or parking.
  • Update and distribute daily production schedules to internal stakeholders.
  • Maintain a daily Stage Status report for Stages and Mill area used by Productions.
  • Manage and track stage power needs.
  • Provide and track Production’s stage HVAC needs.
  • Ancillary invoicing - tracking and billing.
  • Participate in all Office, Stage, and lot walkthroughs for Pre/Post-Production inspections of the property.
  • Moving furniture throughout the offices and in-between buildings in order to accommodate space needed for Productions, tenants or Operations team.
  • Patrol the entire Studio Lot/Fence Line/Stages multiple times per day.
  • Identifying, report and address any safety issues or hazards on the lot.
  • Reporting parking issues, damage, or hazardous materials found to Studio Management Specialist.
  • Participate in Stage and Tech Scouts.
  • Coordinate Stage Power with Production’s Electric and Rigging Electric representative.
  • Supports stage and site tours.
  • Set up drive-ons, notify Security of stage openings, and prepare production schedules.
  • General office support regarding stages and productions.
  • Any other studio related duties as determined by Studio Operations Manager

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in Film and Television experience required.
  • The candidate should be decisive, able to work under strict deadlines, prioritize issues, multitask and adjust to rapid changes in a dynamic production environment.
  • Team player with an ability to supervise multiple productions in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to respond after hours in important, timely, or urgent manners.
  • Ability to be discreet and handle confidential information.
  • Strong knowledge of EHS.
  • Strong knowledge of Stage Safety regulations.
  • Certifications in OSHA Aerial Boom, Scissor, Rough Terrain, and Warehouse ForkLifts, DEEP Hazmat, FSO training (provided by Fire Marshal’s Office), Incipient firefighting techniques & fire extinguisher selection and use, HAZWOPER, are a plus.
  • Ability to lift 100lbs
  • Proficiency in Google Docs, Sheets, Gmail, G-Drive, MS Word, Excel. AirTable is a plus.
  • Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly.
  • Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current production process and equipment and studios.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multitask.
  • Willingness to take educated risks and think out of the box.

Netflix is the leading online video subscription service, reaching hundreds of millions of global households. From creating pivotal moments in story-telling history to rediscovering itself from a streaming service to the world's best studio, Netflix is at the forefront in data-driven business execution. This passion extends well into the world of support, where we offer exceptional customer service for our millions of global members. One way we do this is through high-touch, business-to-business driven support, aiming to solve challenges that our technology and our studio production businesses face.
 
Netflix is on the hunt for an IT support manager to lead our Remote Operations and Support (ROS) team. A Netflix ROS Specialist is not only an expert in a technical field, but is also a passionate solver of any tech problems that a colleague encounters. ROS Specialists play a critical role providing amazing technical support to thousands of internal employees around the world, with a focus on enabling productivity. This position reports to the Netflix Technology (N-Tech) Director of Remote Support and can be remote within the United States. 
 
As a leader of this team, you are responsible for providing vision and context to a world class remote support team. The ROS team focuses on technology issues and requests that can come in via tickets, email, chat, video Meets, phone calls, and automated alerts. Your team is responsible for a multitude of operational tasks such as supporting cloud applications, remote troubleshooting, and account and system administration. You and your team are experts in all our internal and production office technologies and must ensure Netflix employees stay highly productive in the most secure environment possible with great customer satisfaction.
 
As the leader of this group, you’ll set and execute on a vision built on our employee technology principles of simplicity, security, scalability, and service. You will work with global cross functional support teams to align, provide context, and fulfill user requests. You will be responsible for successfully scaling the ROS team while continuing to deliver a stellar experience to all of our employees and contingent workforce. 

Experience:

  • At least 2 years experience managing an IT support team
  • Expert at balancing efficiency and quality success metrics of an IT support operation
  • Experience supporting Cloud and SaaS Applications with a strong preference for Google G Suite experience
  • In depth knowledge of and the ability to perform advanced troubleshooting on Mac OS, Chrome OS, Windows OS, Linux, and various applications
  • You have experience with Google G Suite, JIRA, Confluence, Kibana, Tableau, Zendesk, or similar products
  • Workforce management knowledge, with experience scaling 24/7 global operations
  • Knowledge of best practices around data security and automation of solutions
  • Familiarity with Production based operations, a plus
  • Experience in acquiring and developing skill sets that are not typically found in support roles but lend well to creating an excellent technical support xperience
  • Experience in analyzing and interpreting complex data to formulate actionable initiatives to improve our operations and user experience  

Responsibilities:

  • Living the Netflix Culture and ensuring it is represented within the ROS team
  • Lead the development of the ROS team to best support the technology needs of our global employee base
  • Navigate roadblocks for the team using great judgment to deliver an amazing tech support experience
  • Constantly innovating to improve the employee self service experience (i.e. development of self service tools, education, automation, and knowledge sharing)
  • Helping to set the strategy of the ROS team and working collaboratively with other regional matters to execute that strategy
  • Analyzing a variety of data sources to develop and manage KPIs relevant to your team’s responsibilities and performance
  • Driving end-to-end efficiency within our support flow while avoiding unnecessary processes
  • Creating consistency in the team’s execution by setting clear direction and expectations
  • Partner with cross-functional teams such as information security, workplace services, and network engineering to deliver shared initiatives
  • Work with teams across the organization to understand/solve the technical challenges and needs of their respective groups
  • Write articulate memos to socialize and get feedback on new ideas, proposed tests, provide insight into support issues and team performance, and to gain broader alignment on key tech support decisions
  • Building an inclusive team that fosters different perspectives and unique stories to solve new problems and solutions
At Netflix, we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.  We want to share with you that we are mindful of limited access to resources and opportunities that come with systemic disadvantages.  So if you align strongly with our values and have transferable experiences, we encourage you to apply.

The Director, Production Safety UCAN  will continue building a high impact team of health & safety professionals that support Netflix Production throughout the UCAN  region across all Production Verticals working within the Physical Production leadership team for the Region..  You will work with our Regional Production Safety Directors and the Centre of Excellence team for Production Safety to help continue to strategically develop and deploy a worldwide approach to Production Safety alongside leading deployment in UCAN , localising for effectiveness; taking into consideration the local safety and production environment.  

You will provide thoughtful leadership and will be able to leverage the expertise of a world-class team, the goal is to continue developing and scaling a world-class production safety program that delivers effective and innovative safety solutions to protect the people who create Netflix’s industry-leading content.

Job Responsibilities

  • Lead and develop a team of production safety professionals that support all Production verticals in UCAN .
  • Partner with our HR, Legal, Studio Operations, Corporate and Risk Management teams 
  • Provide innovative and effective input to develop the Netflix Global approach and tools for Production Safety
  • Mindfully implement key elements of the worldwide approach to Production Safety within UCAN .
  • Oversee localisation of the global approach to ensure impact and compliance to relevant legislative and industry requirements.
  • Oversee the development of unique solutions where needed - aligning with the global safety approach as appropriate.
  • Work with Production Partners to establish appropriate levels of Production Safety support for different producing arrangements and risk profiles of productions
  • Respond to, and review incidents of note and support a response in a timely manner as needed (dependant upon the nature and potential impact off an incident)
  • Develop and maintain effective working relationships with industry safety organizations, employee representatives and governmental regulatory agencies as appropriate
  • Support with the development of the informal worldwide network of the production safety team to share knowledge and learning.

  • Strong safety system/program development and deployment experience with a multinational company that has experienced rapid growth.
  • Master's Degree in Health & Safety, Environmental Studies, Physical Sciences, related major or equivalent experience.

postings.text: Counsel, Animation Business & Legal Affairs - EMEA
postings.description:
The Opportunity
With millions of subscribers enjoying great content in over 190 countries, it is an exciting time to work at Netflix. Our efforts have brought Netflix to virtually all countries around the globe, and as we continue to scale our content, we are looking for top talent to join our teams and help propel our growth around the world.
 
The Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) division of our Animation Series team is seeking an experienced, intellectually curious business and legal affairs attorney to help support our new and rapidly growing animated programming business. This team is central to Netflix’s growth strategy, and focuses on developing and producing animated original series from across the region.
 
The role:
In this role, you will help develop business and legal affairs strategy across the region and be responsible to structure, negotiate and draft agreements necessary to develop, produce and/or license animated programming from rights acquisition through production, post-production and exhibition on Netflix’s global streaming service. You will be familiar with doing business in the region (with an emphasis on France, Spain, and the UK), have a strong understanding of commercial terms for animated programming in-region, and an awareness of the animation landscape, producers and rights holders in-region more generally.
 
The successful candidate will partner closely with cross functional teams working on International animated series in the region -- Content, Intellectual Property, Physical Production, Consumer Products, and Production Finance -- and will be an integral part of the growing Content Legal group in EMEA. They should be extremely comfortable counseling business partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impacts, and should be adept at developing and fostering relationships with their counterparts within the EMEA production community.
 
The position will be based in Amsterdam and will require significant travel throughout the EMEA region. 

Requirements

  • 3+ years of post-qualification experience at a law firm, production company, studio, talent agency, or other media company in EMEA with a focus on development and production matters in the animation space. 
  • Direct experience drafting and negotiating all forms of rights acquisition and production agreements for animated programming (including both above-the-line and below-the-line agreements)
  • Practical knowledge of the industry, producers and distributors throughout the region. 
  • Must speak fluent English, and additional French language fluency is a plus. 
  • Experience with consumer products and kids focused intellectual property and franchises is also a plus.

The Netflix experience is available across a wide variety of devices such as Smart TVs, set top boxes, game consoles, and mobile phones. Our reach, ease-of-use, and subscriber growth have been propelled by strong partnerships with many of the world's leading telcos and consumer electronics companies. This role will focus specifically on our consumer electronics partners (Smart TV, Set Top Box/Streaming Stick, Game Consoles) through which the Netflix app is available.

The Partnerships SP&A team is responsible for evaluating opportunities and analyzing the performance of existing partnerships. Partnerships impact millions of members, and the outcome of our analyses plays a critical role in the growth and strategy of Netflix. 
During negotiations, we provide guidance to the Business Development team using data and analysis. When partnerships are launched, we monitor their performance and search for areas of improvement. We also work closely with the Product team to determine which changes in the Netflix experience could improve the partnerships’ impact.  

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Evaluating the financial impact of partnership opportunities (e.g., Netflix app preinstalled on Smart TV’s) 
  • Financial projections and scenario modeling 
  • Risk identification and mitigation strategies 
  • Advising the Business Development and Partner Solutions teams based on the results of analyses
  • Analyzing the performance of existing partnerships to extract actionable insights (e.g., best practices, areas of improvement)  
  • Creating insightful presentations that facilitate decision-making for internal stakeholders and our external partners  
  • Partnering with the Product team to help identify, prioritize and assess the impact of app placement and launch points
  • Providing inputs to other teams working on partnerships related initiatives (e.g. Consumer Insights, Corporate FP&A, Payments, etc.) 
  • Develop consumer electronic expertise, understanding relative regional performance of different devices and their product-market fit for Netflix

REQUIREMENTS

  • 4-6 years of experience, ideally in management consulting or similar field
  • Extensive experience conducting quantitative analysis that leads to actionable insights
  • Team player with strong interpersonal skills, but also able to work independently  
  • Adept at managing multiple projects and stakeholders on a regular basis
  • Skilled in preparing effective presentations with clear narrative 
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong Excel and google sheets skills (mandatory) 
  • Proficiency with Tableau and SQL
  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature

Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of performing comprehensive analyses independently and proactively. At Netflix’s Creative Lab, we are creative directors, creative strategists, data lovers, envelope pushers, and artists. Our shared purpose is to increase the effectiveness of Netflix promotional creative. We do this by reimagining what promotional creative can be, inspired by insights around the brand, business context, consumer, culture and new media. We turn our hypotheses into experiments and learn “does it work?”, “why?” and “how?.” As a team, we always think big, stay curious and together challenge the status quo. 

We are looking for a Creative Strategist to join our growing creative strategy team. In this role, you will dream up and execute experiments, independently and in partnership with creatives, with the goal of getting to breakthrough learnings that elevate Netflix’s creative excellence and effectiveness. Your work will help Netflix uncover new approaches to promotional creative to better connect with the hearts and minds of current and future Netflix users. 

In this role you will…

  • Lead creative tests end-to-end in partnership with Creative Leads, Data Strategy, Marketing, Growth Advertising, Brand, and Creative Production
  • Develop and take ownership of the strategic intent, objectives, and creative insights that inform our creative tests, while ensuring that the tests align with the Creative Lab’s learning agenda priorities 
  • Pose thought-provoking questions that challenge the way Netflix approaches promotional creative
  • Inform, inspire, and guide creative ideation through insights-driven consumer research, cultural research, brand/product truths, and media opportunities 
  • Work closely with creatives throughout the creative development process to craft assets based on hypotheses and learnings of what works best for the audience or media touchpoint
  • Work closely with the Creative Strategy Manager to set ongoing testing priorities, direct cultural and consumer research initiatives, and recommend new types of testing methodologies
  • Collaborate with data strategists to interpret and disseminate learnings that will shape how partners internally/externally approach promotional creative 
  • Be a creative insights thought-leader on a new and growing experimentation team at Netflix, continuously inspiring the team with new trends and consumer behaviors 

Must-Haves…

  • You are a left and right-brain thinker. You can balance making effective creative that drives measurable results, while being protective of creative integrity and instinct
  • You are a swiss-army knife of strategic disciplines. You know brand strategy as much as you know business strategy. You are as keen on cultural insights as much as you are with designing your own consumer research. This is reflected in your problem-solving approach. 
  • Background in creative strategy at a creative agency, consulting firm or brand
  • Passion for partnering closely with creatives at every step of the journey, including initial hypotheses, creative brief, ideation, asset development and test design
  • Must be highly collaborative and able to partner cross-functionally with growth marketers, brand marketers, regional marketers, and media strategists 
  • Outstanding story-telling, communication, presentation and people skills
  • Passion for content, art, new media and/or entertainment 
  • Experience with global, multi-market creative and/or advertising work
  • Curiosity for new ways of experimenting with creative on social channels and beyond
  • Hunger to understand the “why” behind creative effectiveness
  • Excitement for breaking convention and asking “what are we not doing yet that we should be doing?”

Nice-to-Haves...

  • Experience with creative testing, including A/B testing
  • Experience running creative workshops
  • Experience designing research and working with research vendors
  • Experience working on consumer focused technology, entertainment, and/or gaming brands

Do you want to help tell the story of Netflix? Do you enjoy shaping communications strategy and messaging? Are you a pop culture junkie? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment? If so, we may have just the opportunity for the right person on the communications team.

The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to more than 204 million streaming members in over 190 countries. This is the total package -- a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading and handling communications for a fast-growing and highly admired company. And you’ll get to work with some of the most exciting and creative people in the business.

We are looking for a talented communications executive with a strong understanding and relationship with consumer, lifestyle and trade media across the U.S.  The Manager will play a critical role on the team responsible for developing press stories, narratives, and campaigns around the role Netflix plays in transforming entertainment. This role requires a fluency around our content, and a strategic mind that can take data and insights to create meaningful PR campaigns. The role will also work closely with our film, series, social media, brand and marketing teams. 

The Role:

  • Lead proactive storytelling with consumer, lifestyle and broadcast media for Netflix
  • Partner closely with social media and marketing teams to create 360 campaigns
  • Write and own actionable communications project briefs, seeing the whole process through from start to finish
  • Cultivate and manage relationships with relevant reporters
  • Stay current on trends, social issues, and industry news so that you have your finger on the pulse of current events and how to think big and creatively for proactive campaigns.
  • Manage daily incoming media inquiries relating to executives;  and generate creative, proactive ideas and media opportunities for how executives show up publicly

  • The successful candidate will likely have 8+ years of experience in an in-house and/or agency setting used to working in a fast paced and ever changing environment. 
  • Proven ability to secure feature storiesHave a deep understanding and expertise of the U.S. media landscape -- day-to-day media contacts in broadcast, print and digital are a mustA knowledge and understanding of integrated brand campaigns, marketing and social media.

  • Be confident and creative in writing, capable of crafting everything from executive messaging to consumer facing newsletters, press releases and everything in between.
  • Love brands, appreciate a good brief and understand what to do with a genuine insight
  • Really love entertainment...broad knowledge of TV/film, entertainment, pop culture and lifestyle trends is expected and being a TV, movie or Netflix junkie is even better.

Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

Netflix is seeking an experienced Content Designer (Content Strategist, UX Writer, Product Writer) for Interactive, the team that made Emmy-winning “Black Mirror: Bandersnatch” possible.

About the Interactive team
Part of Netflix Experience Design, the Interactive team creates experiences to entertain and delight members around the world. Collaborating with the world’s best storytellers, we leverage our product and content expertise to design experiences where viewers interact and engage with stories in memorable new ways.

About the role
This is a unique role in that you’ll partner with product designers, product managers, consumer insights and others to push the boundaries of what’s possible in streaming entertainment. As Interactive’s only Content Designer, you’ll act as the evangelist across cross-functional teams and within the Content Design team, ensuring that the messaging for Interactive is consistent across the product for members and in materials to content partners. You’ll also create language guidelines for interactive formats and think through UI patterns for our internal production tools. 

About you

  • You’re a storyteller at heart who can craft and orchestrate cohesive narratives across product touchpoints and work with cross-functional partners on execution.
  • You’re a systems thinker who’s familiar with the development of design systems and guidelines that can scale globally.
  • You’re a product thinker who enjoys innovating and finding creative solutions. 
  • You thrive on collaboration and can communicate productively with visual thinkers and other partners.
  • You are confident in advocating for your point of view in our candid, feedback-driven culture.
  • You're comfortable with ambiguity and are self-directed. You find ways to make a meaningful impact without waiting for approvals. 
  • You possess a keen sense of empathy for the entertainment industry and a burning curiosity about where it’s headed.

Qualifications

  • 10+ years of relevant writing experience: UX writing, content strategy, consumer-focused copywriting, short-form digital
  • Expertise in interactive content preferred
  • Experience working on a product design or UX team, and with global brands
  • Ability to think critically about user journeys and content flows, and to connect the dots between them
  • Experience with A/B testing and using data to inform design decisions
  • Demonstrable creativity
  • Highly collaborative and self-directed
  • Proficiency in languages other than English and experience in the world of entertainment are a plus
This full-time, salaried position reports to the XD Content Design Manager.

With over 208 million paid memberships in 190+ countries, Netflix is changing the way we tell and share stories across the globe.  We are growing rapidly, creating TV series, films and documentaries in a diverse range of countries and languages around the world, including Korea. 

Original Korean content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of Korean originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world.

Like all great companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. What is special about Netflix, among other things, is our Culture. 

Find out more about Who We Are and what our Culture is like.

The Role
We’re looking for an experienced Finance Manager to be based in Seoul that will be responsible for the various finance obligations of Netflix’s operations in Korea.  The Manager will work with various teams internationally to optimize the overall finance operations and processes in terms of accounting, compliance and reporting. In addition the Manager will be a business partner to the various cross-functional teams in our Korea office. 

The ideal candidate is a strong fit with the Netflix culture, can collaborate well across the organization and has a hands-on mentality.

We’re looking for someone who is:

  • A proactive and innovative self-starter,  who is able to drive projects and problem-solve
  • A great communicator that can build strong working relationships with external advisors and internal teams
  • Able to quickly understand and integrate our business priorities with our finance objectives
  • Accustomed to multitasking, prioritising and meeting multiple tight deadlines
  • Curious and enthusiastic, that’s not afraid to ask questions and challenge the status quo
  • Able to exercise great judgement and can provide strategic and pragmatic insights on various finance and accounting projects
  • Highly accurate and detail-oriented 
  • Flexible to collaborate with Netflix teams across multiple offices and timezones

Education and Experience

  • 10+ years of relevant accounting and finance experience
  • A combination of public accounting experience and in-house experience is preferred
  • Degree in Finance/Accounting and a Chartered Accountant 
  • Experience in efficiently working in a multinational environment and working with service providers
  • Experience in managing / building teams 
  • Strong knowledge of Korean IFRS and US GAAP
  • Demonstrated ability to innovate and optimise workflows and processes
  • Strong experience with preparing statutory filing documentation for international entities and leading / managing statutory audits
  • Experience with Workday Financials or other cloud based ERP systems is a plus
  • Systems and automation experience a plus
  • Experience in the entertainment / tech industry is a plus

postings.text: Senior Software Engineer (Pipeline) - Animation Studio Technology
postings.description:
It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. We’ve become one of the largest entertainment studios in the world, creating new original content at an incredible pace.  The Studio Innovation product team is front and center of this growth. We build software that fuels the production and creation of Netflix content. The Animation Studio Technology team within Studio Innovation builds products that power the Netflix Animation Studio ecosystem. Netflix is on a path to release six animated feature films per year, which no major studio has ever done, on top of the very healthy slate of animation series.

About the Role:
A Software Engineer (Production Pipeline) designs and implements tools and systems that manage and visualize the data used to create animated feature films. The Digital Animation Pipeline (DAP) team is responsible for integrating proprietary and third-party tools into production. Pipeline Engineers are involved with every production department from Design to Final Render. Pipeline Engineers standardize the workflow to ensure a clean handoff of data. Each engineer is responsible for producing reliable and reusable code and provides assistance to Technical Directors during the design and deployment of departmental tools.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop storage solutions, web services, and APIs to support a cloud-based pipeline for animation production.
  • Develop a distributed, collaborative platform for the integration of the multiple 3rd-party tools required for pre-production, asset development, and shot production.
  • Work closely with the other Netflix Software Engineering teams to leverage shared platform technology and ensure successful software deployment.
  • Troubleshoot and debug problems across multiple departments and software packages.
  • Work with all departments to perfect workflow and data transfer.
  • Continually review the pipeline and provide solutions to increase overall efficiency.

Qualifications:

  • Strong programming skills. Extensive experience in Python, C++, or Java.
  • Familiarity with 3rd party tools like Maya, Houdini, Nuke, ShotGrid, and their APIs.
  • Experience with multiple GUI toolkits (Qt a plus).
  • Experience with back-end persistent storage mechanisms such as SQL, Protobuf, JSON is a plus.
  • Ability to establish priorities, drive results and work independently or within a group.
  • Exceptional communication skills in dealing with both technical and artistic groups.
For more information on what it’s like to work at Netflix, please take a look at our culture memo!
